sentences.en: He sat on the terrace of his sun-drenched villa in the South of France.
sentences.cn: 他坐在自己位于法国南部的阳光别墅的露天平台上。

sentences.en: He was drenched through with rain.
sentences.cn: 他被雨淋得全身湿淋淋的.
大雨浇得他全身都湿透了.

sentences.en: His face blanched as he looked at Sharpe's blood-drenched uniform.
sentences.cn: 他一看到夏普浸满鲜血的制服，脸色顿时变得煞白。

sentences.en: I was drenched to the skin.
Moshing down the front, crushed against the stage in a sweat-drenched T-shirt is all part of the gig experience.
sentences.cn: 穿着被汗水浸透了的T恤衫，拥到台前，狂舞着，这就是摇滚音乐会上的体验。

sentences.en: My clothes are drenched with sweat.
She was drenched through with rain.
The man was drenched to the skin.
sentences.cn: 这人全身上下都湿透了.

sentences.en: The people there have been drenched.
sentences.cn: 那边的人都被雨淋透了.

sentences.en: They turned fire hoses on the people and drenched them.
sentences.cn: 他们将消防水管对着人们，把他们浇了个透。

sentences.en: They were getting drenched by icy water.
sentences.cn: 他们被冰冷的水浇透了。

sentences.en: We were caught in the storm and got drenched to the skin.
sentences.cn: 我们遇上了暴雨，淋得浑身透湿。

sentences.en: We were completely drenched and cold.
sentences.cn: 我们浑身湿透了，冻得冰冷。

words.tran_cn: 浸湿；强使服药；覆盖（drench的过去分词）

trans.tran_en: covered with a lot of a liquid

trans.tran_cn: 使湿透( drench的过去式和过去分词 )，在某人（某物）上大量使用（某液体）
